org.xlattice.util.cmdline

Class ArgCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.util.cmdline.ArgCursor

  • class ArgCursor
extends java.lang.Object
    Cursor over an array of command-line arguments. The argument list is sanitized before being copied here.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected ArgCursor(java.lang.String[] source)
      Create a cursor over a copy of an array of command line arguments.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasNext() 
      int index() 
      int length() 
      java.lang.String next()
      Returns next arg, advancing the cursor.
      java.lang.String peek()
      Returns next argument without advancing the cursor.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgCursor

        protected ArgCursor(java.lang.String[] source)
        Create a cursor over a copy of an array of command line arguments. The copied arguments have leading and trailing whitespace trimmed off.
        Parameters:
        source - the original array of arguments

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public int index()
        Returns:
        the current position in the arg array

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns:
        the number of arguments

      • peek

        public java.lang.String peek()
        Returns next argument without advancing the cursor.
        Returns:
        reference to next arg

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns:
        Whether there is another argument.

      • next

        public java.lang.String next()
        Returns next arg, advancing the cursor.
        Returns:
        reference to next argument
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
